snippet: The pizzerias, a few feet apart on Avenue of the Americas, both raised their prices after cutting them to 75 cents a slice in March.
abstract: Owners of two neighboring Midtown Manhattan pizza parlors agree to end a several-month-long price war that saw the cost of their slices plummet to 75 cents each; both businesses, realizing they were losing money, agreed to return to selling $1 slices, ending the brush with mutually assured destruction.
lead_paragraph: The pizzerias, a few feet apart on Avenue of the Americas, both raised their prices after cutting them to 75 cents a slice in March.

headline.seo: Two Manhattan Pizza Parlors End Price War
headline.main: $1 Pizza Slice Is Back After a Sidewalk Showdown Ends Two Parlors’ Price War
headline.print_headline: $1 Pizza Slice Is Back After a Sidewalk Showdown Ends Two Parlors’ Price War
